summary:
President Trump said today he will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank, a move that changes U.S. signals to Israeli leaders and could force Prime Minister Netanyahu to revise or delay annexation plans. The declaration was coupled with wider assertive actions: Mr. Trump also announced 100 percent tariffs on imported drugs, trucks and kitchen cabinets and pressed Turkey to halt Russian oil purchases amid F-35 negotiations, signaling a more transactional U.S. posture on trade and security. The combined decisions link American commercial pressure to diplomatic leverage and are likely to prompt immediate talks with Israeli officials and NATO partners, an uptick in market volatility, and possible retaliatory trade measures within days to weeks.

Other developments touched law, rights, humanitarian aid and public safety. A UN report says Iran uses drones, facial recognition and a citizen app to enforce hijab rules, raising civil liberties and surveillance concerns that could influence sanctions and digital-rights debates. The UN secretary-general and top diplomats pleaded for sustained funding for UNRWA as Gaza needs grow, a request that matters for donor budgets and refugee protection. Domestic safety reviews found LA County firefighting hampered by outdated policies and resource gaps, prompting calls for immediate reforms and funding. Donors face near-term decisions on UNRWA funding, local authorities must enact firefighting reforms, and the contested Comey indictment will proceed into court.

headlines.title: Trump says he will not allow Israel to annex West Bank.
headlines.summary: Trump says his stance blocks Israel's annexation plan, shaping Netanyahu's policy and regional dynamics; experts say the decision could affect future talks.

headlines.title: Trump says he imposes 100 percent tariffs on drugs, trucks, and kitchen cabinets.
headlines.summary: Tariffs target medicines, heavy trucks, home fixtures and furniture, heightening a global trade dispute; observers expect broader market disruption and potential retaliation.

headlines.title: UN says Iran uses drones to enforce hijab law.
headlines.summary: A UN report notes Tehran uses drone surveillance, facial recognition, and a citizen app to punish hijab violations; experts warn about civil liberties concerns.

headlines.title: Officials allege James Comey indicted on two charges.
headlines.summary: Prosecutors file charges accusing Comey of lying to Congress regarding leaks; the indictment marks a rare legal action against a former FBI director.

headlines.title: Trump says Turkey should stop buying Russian oil amid F-35 talks.
headlines.summary: US pressure on Ankara mirrors ongoing F-35 negotiations; analysts say sanctions and security concerns could influence Turkey's defense purchases and alliance dynamics.

headlines.title: UN chief and top diplomats plead for support for UNRWA amid Gaza crisis.
headlines.summary: Leaders urge continued funding for UNRWA as Gaza humanitarian needs intensify; donors consider financial commitments and long-term support to Palestinian refugees.

headlines.title: Trump signs order to facilitate TikTok sale to US buyers.
headlines.summary: The move aims to shift platform control to U.S. buyers amid security concerns; Beijing has not confirmed the plan.

headlines.title: LA County response to deadly fires slowed by lack of resources.
headlines.summary: Report cites outdated policies and communication gaps that delayed firefighting; officials say reforms and funding are needed to shorten future response times.
